alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:18PM EDT until August 12 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT FOR HANCOCK COUNTY... At 1217 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Arlington, or 8 miles south of Findlay, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Findlay, Fostoria, Arlington, Arcadia, Rawson, Vanlue, Mount Blanchard, Benton Ridge, Jenera and Williamstown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
